etymology.description: 又(又) (yòu, "again") + 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") -> phonetic and semantic components
etymology.interpretation: The character 右(右) (yòu, "right") combines 又(又) (yòu, "again") for its phonetic value and 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") as a semantic component to distinguish its meaning. Initially, 又(又) alone was used in oracle bone script to convey 'right', but the addition of 口(口) during the bronze inscription period served as a distinguishing mark without direct meaning contribution.

examples.chinese: 当你到达十字路口时(當你到達十字路口時)，请向右行走(請向右行走)。
examples.pinyin: Dāng nǐ dào dá shí zì lù kǒu shí, qǐng xiàng yòu xíng zǒu.
examples.english: When you reach the intersection, please walk to the right.

examples.chinese: 他的右手握紧了笔(他的右手握緊了筆)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de yòu shǒu wò jǐn le bǐ.
examples.english: His right hand holds the pen tightly.
